poem:
Title: "Testament of Change"

As the spring lamb
dances to life's new song,
She births joy and sorrow,
In a memoir's earnest throng.
Split by spite and humour,
Yet united by a pen.
An enduring foliage of feelings,
In the sun-kissed den.
Beneath the shroud of hardship,
Echoes a resonating refrain,
Life is but a cyclical season,
Of love, loss and gain.
